citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:00am on 07-JUL-
23. The licensee was contacted and indicated she would not be available at the home site until the end of August 2023.
An AWA compliance inspection could not be conducted because there was no facility representative available to
accompany the inspector. This is the FIRST attempted inspection of the licensee.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The three (3) month post pre-license inspection was attempted at the home site on 07/07/23. The licensee was in Miami,
FL exhibiting her performing dogs. The licensee had not submitted an itinerary to indicate her travel status.
Travel itineraries reduce attempted inspections and facilitate routine unannounced animal welfare inspections while
animals are not housed at the home site. Traveling exhibitors must submit written itineraries to the Deputy Administrator
and include complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any
location other than the licensee's approved home site.
Correct by June 15, 2023.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:00am on 07-JUL-
23. The licensee was contacted and indicated she would not be available at the home site until the end of August 2023.  
 
An AWA compliance inspection could not be conducted because there was no facility representative available to 
accompany the inspector. This is the FIRST attempted inspection of the licensee. 
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The three (3) month post pre-license inspection was attempted at the home site on 07/07/23. The licensee was in Miami, 
FL exhibiting her performing dogs. The licensee had not submitted an itinerary to indicate her travel status.  
 
Travel itineraries reduce attempted inspections and facilitate routine unannounced animal welfare inspections while 
animals are not housed at the home site. Traveling exhibitors must submit written itineraries to the Deputy Administrator 
and include complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any 
location other than the licensee's approved home site.  
Correct by June 15, 2023. 
 
 
End Section
